alert.note: Alert for Chenango; Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:28AM EST until December 21 at 4:45AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Binghamton Washington Street affecting Broome County. Susquehanna River At Waverly/Sayre affecting Bradford and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Bainbridge affecting Chenango and Delaware Counties. Susquehanna River At Unadilla affecting Otsego and Delaware Counties. Susquehanna River Near Windsor affecting Broome County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Owego affecting Tioga County. Susquehanna River At Towanda affecting Bradford County. Susquehanna River Near Wilkes-Barre affecting Luzerne County. Susquehanna River At Meshoppen affecting Wyoming County. Susquehanna River At Vestal affecting Broome and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Conklin affecting Susquehanna and Broome Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River at Bainbridge. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Minor flooding begins to impact the ball fields, trails and buildings on Willow Street Extension in Sidney. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 18.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
